data: “One late afternoon in September Jo Morey—she was better known in the village of Point of Pines as Mam’selle Jo—stood on the tiny lawn lying between her trim white house and the broad highway, lifted her eyes from the earth, that had long been her battlefield, and murmured aloud as lonely people often do,”
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: american literature
